clause.text: many have taken in hand to set in order a narrative of those things which have been fulfilled among us,
those who from the beginning were eyewitnesses and ministers of the word delivered them to us,
it seemed good to me also,
having had perfect understanding of all things from the very first,
to write to you an orderly account, most excellent Theophilus,
you may know the certainty of those things in which you were instructed.
There was in the days of Herod, the king of Judea, a certain priest named Zacharias, of the division of Abijah.
His wife [was] of the daughters of Aaron,
they were both righteous before God,
walking in all the commandments and ordinances of the Lord blameless.
they were both well advanced in years.
while he was serving as priest before God in the order of his division,
according to the custom of the priesthood, his lot fell to burn incense
he went into the temple of the Lord.
the whole multitude of the people was praying outside at the hour of incense.
an angel of the Lord appeared to him,
standing on the right side of the altar of incense.
your wife Elizabeth will bear you a son,
you shall call his name John.
you will have joy and gladness,
many will rejoice at his birth.
he will be great in the sight of the Lord,
shall drink neither wine nor strong drink.
He will also be filled with the Holy Spirit, even from his mother's womb.
he will turn many of the children of Israel to the Lord their God.
"He will also go before Him in the spirit and power of Elijah,
'to turn the hearts of the fathers to the children,'
the disobedient to the wisdom of the just,
to make ready a people prepared for the Lord."
my wife is well advanced in years."
"I am Gabriel, who stands in the presence of God,
was sent to speak to you
the day these things take place,
you did not believe my words which will be fulfilled in their own time."
he lingered so long in the temple.
he could not speak to them;
he had seen a vision in the temple,
the days of his service were completed,
he departed to his own house.
after those days his wife Elizabeth conceived;
"Thus the Lord has dealt with me, in the days when He looked on [me],
to take away my reproach among people."
in the sixth month the angel Gabriel was sent by God to a city of Galilee named Nazareth,
to a virgin betrothed to a man whose name was Joseph, of the house of David.
she was troubled at his saying,
considered what manner of greeting this was.
you have found favor with God.
behold, you will conceive in your womb
will be called the Son of the Highest;
the Lord God will give Him the throne of His father David.
He will reign over the house of Jacob forever,
of His kingdom there will be no end."
I do not know a man?"
"The Holy Spirit will come upon you,
the power of the Highest will overshadow you;
that Holy One who is to be born will be called the Son of God.
indeed, Elizabeth your relative has also conceived a son in her old age;
this is now the sixth month for her who was called barren.
with God nothing will be impossible."
Let it be to me according to your word."
went into the hill country with haste, to a city of Judah,
Elizabeth heard the greeting of Mary,
the babe leaped in her womb;
Elizabeth was filled with the Holy Spirit.
she spoke out with a loud voice
blessed [is] the fruit of your womb!
the mother of my Lord should come to me?
the voice of your greeting sounded in my ears,
the babe leaped in my womb for joy.
there will be a fulfillment of those things which were told her from the Lord."
my spirit has rejoiced in God my Savior.
He has regarded the lowly state of His maidservant;
behold, henceforth all generations will call me blessed.
He who is mighty has done great things for me,
His mercy [is] on those who fear Him From generation to generation.
He has shown strength with His arm,
He has scattered [the] proud in the imagination of their hearts.
He has put down the mighty from [their] thrones,
He has filled [the] hungry with good things,
[the] rich He has sent away empty.
He has helped His servant Israel, In remembrance of [His] mercy,
He spoke to our fathers, To Abraham and to his seed forever."
Mary remained with her about three months,
Elizabeth's full time came for her to be delivered,
her neighbors and relatives heard how the Lord had shown great mercy to her,
it was, on the eighth day,
they came to circumcise the child;
they would have called him by the name of his father, Zacharias.
"There is no one among your relatives who is called by this name."
they made signs to his father --
what he would have him called.
he asked for a writing tablet,
fear came on all who dwelt around them;
all these sayings were discussed throughout all the hill country of Judea.
all those who heard [them] kept [them] in their hearts,
"What kind of child will this be?"
the hand of the Lord was with him.
his father Zacharias was filled with the Holy Spirit,
has raised up a horn of salvation for us In the house of His servant David,
He spoke by the mouth of His holy prophets, Who [have] [been] since the world began,
we should be saved from our enemies And from the hand of all who hate us,
To perform the mercy [promised] to our fathers
The oath which He swore to our father Abraham,
we, Being delivered from the hand of our enemies,
In holiness and righteousness before Him all the days of our life.
you, child, will be called the prophet of the Highest;
you will go before the face of the Lord
To give knowledge of salvation to His people By the remission of their sins,
Through the tender mercy of our God, With which the Dayspring from on high has visited us,
To give light to those who sit in darkness and the shadow of death,
To guide our feet into the way of peace."
was in the deserts till the day of his manifestation to Israel.
it came to pass in those days
a decree went out from Caesar Augustus
all the world should be registered.
This census first took place while Quirinius was governing Syria.
all went to be registered, everyone to his own city.
Joseph also went up from Galilee, out of the city of Nazareth, into Judea, to the city of David, which is called Bethlehem,
he was of the house and lineage of David,
to be registered with Mary, his betrothed wife, who was with child.
the days were completed for her to be delivered.
she brought forth her firstborn Son,
there was no room for them in the inn.
there were in the same country shepherds living out in the fields,
keeping watch over their flock by night.
behold, an angel of the Lord stood before them,
the glory of the Lord shone around them,
behold, I bring you good tidings of great joy which will be to all people.
there is born to you this day in the city of David a Savior, who is Christ the Lord.
You will find a Babe wrapped in swaddling cloths,
suddenly there was with the angel a multitude of the heavenly host praising God and
"Glory to God in the highest, And on earth peace, goodwill toward men!"
the angels had gone away from them into heaven,
the shepherds said to one another,
see this thing that has come to pass, which the Lord has made known to us."
the Babe lying in a manger.
they made widely known the saying which was told them concerning this Child.
all those who heard [it] marveled at those things which were told them by the shepherds.
praising God for all the things that they had heard
eight days were completed for the circumcision of the Child,
the name given by the angel before He was conceived in the womb.
the days of her purification according to the law of Moses were completed,
it is written in the law of the Lord,
"Every male who opens the womb shall be called holy to the LORD")
to offer a sacrifice according to what is said in the law of the Lord, "A pair of turtledoves or two young pigeons."
behold, there was a man in Jerusalem whose name was Simeon,
waiting for the Consolation of Israel,
the Holy Spirit was upon him.
it had been revealed to him by the Holy Spirit
he would not see death before he had seen the Lord's Christ.
he came by the Spirit into the temple.
the parents brought in the Child Jesus,
to do for Him according to the custom of the law,
he took Him up in his arms
You are letting Your servant depart in peace, According to Your word,
my eyes have seen Your salvation,
Which You have prepared before the face of all peoples,
A light to [bring] revelation to the Gentiles, And the glory of Your people Israel."
Joseph and His mother marveled at those things which were spoken of Him.
"Behold, this [Child] is destined for the fall
for a sign which will be spoken against,
"(yes, a sword will pierce through your own soul also),
the thoughts of many hearts may be revealed."
there was one, Anna, a prophetess, the daughter of Phanuel, of the tribe of Asher.
She was of a great age,
had lived with a husband seven years from her virginity,
this woman [was] a widow of about eighty-four years, who did not depart from the temple,
served [God] with fastings and prayers night and day.
she gave thanks to the Lord,
spoke of Him to all those who looked for redemption in Jerusalem.
they had performed all things according to the law of the Lord,
they returned to Galilee, to their [own] city, Nazareth.
the grace of God was upon Him.
His parents went to Jerusalem every year at the Feast of the Passover.
they went up to Jerusalem according to the custom of the feast.
the Boy Jesus lingered behind in Jerusalem.
Joseph and His mother did not know [it];
supposing Him to have been in the company,
sought Him among [their] relatives and acquaintances.
after three days they found Him in the temple,
sitting in the midst of the teachers,
all who heard Him were astonished at His understanding and answers.
"Son, why have You done this to us?
Your father and I have sought You anxiously."
I must be about My Father's business?"
they did not understand the statement which He spoke to them.
His mother kept all these things in her heart.
Jesus increased in wisdom and stature, and in favor with God and men.

in the fifteenth year of the reign of Tiberius Caesar, Pontius Pilate being governor of Judea, Herod being tetrarch of Galilee, his brother Philip tetrarch of Iturea and the region of Trachonitis, and Lysanias tetrarch of Abilene,
Annas and Caiaphas were high priests,
the word of God came to John the son of Zacharias in the wilderness.
he went into all the region around the Jordan,
preaching a baptism of repentance for the remission of sins,
it is written in the book of the words of Isaiah the prophet,
"The voice of one crying in the wilderness,
every mountain and hill brought low,
The crooked places shall be made straight
all flesh shall see the salvation of God.'"
he said to the multitudes that came out to be baptized by him,
Who warned you to flee from the wrath to come?
do not begin to say to yourselves,
God is able to raise up children to Abraham from these stones.
even now the ax is laid to the root of the trees.
every tree which does not bear good fruit is cut down
"He who has two tunics, let him give to him who has none;
he who has food, let him do likewise."
tax collectors also came to be baptized,
"Collect no more than what is appointed for you."
as the people were in expectation,
all reasoned in their hearts about John,
One mightier than I is coming, whose sandal strap I am not worthy to loose.
He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and fire.
He will thoroughly clean out His threshing floor,
gather the wheat into His barn;
the chaff He will burn with unquenchable fire."
with many other exhortations he preached to the people.
Herod the tetrarch, being rebuked by him concerning Herodias, his brother Philip's wife,
for all the evils which Herod had done,
he shut John up in prison.
the Holy Spirit descended in bodily form like a dove upon Him,
a voice came from heaven which said,
in You I am well pleased."

Jesus, being filled with the Holy Spirit,
was led by the Spirit into the wilderness,
being tempted for forty days by the devil.
in those days He ate nothing,
You are the Son of God,
command this stone to become bread."
'Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word of God.'"
the devil, taking Him up on a high mountain, showed Him all the kingdoms of the world in a moment of time.
"All this authority I will give You, and their glory;
I give it to whomever I wish.
'You shall worship the LORD your God,
set Him on the pinnacle of the temple,
You are the Son of God,
'He shall give His angels charge over you,
'In their hands they shall bear you up,
you dash your foot against a stone.'"
'You shall not tempt the LORD your God.'"
the devil had ended every temptation,
he departed from Him until an opportune time.
Jesus returned in the power of the Spirit to Galilee,
news of Him went out through all the surrounding region.
He came to Nazareth, where He had been brought up.
He went into the synagogue on the Sabbath day,
He was handed the book of the prophet Isaiah.
He found the place where it was written,
"The Spirit of the LORD [is] upon Me,
He has anointed Me To preach the gospel to [the] poor,
He has sent Me to heal the brokenhearted,
To set at liberty those who are oppressed,
To proclaim the acceptable year of the LORD."
the eyes of all who were in the synagogue were fixed on Him.
He began to say to them,
"Today this Scripture is fulfilled in your hearing."
marveled at the gracious words which proceeded out of His mouth.
"You will surely say this proverb to Me,
Whatever we have heard done in Capernaum,
do also here in Your country.'"
no prophet is accepted in his own country.
many widows were in Israel in the days of Elijah,
the heaven was shut up three years and six months,
there was a great famine throughout all the land,
to none of them was Elijah sent except to Zarephath, [in] [the] [region] of Sidon, to a woman [who] [was] a widow.
many lepers were in Israel in the time of Elisha the prophet,
none of them was cleansed except Naaman the Syrian."
all those in the synagogue, when they heard these things, were filled with wrath,
thrust Him out of the city;
they led Him to the brow of the hill on which their city was built,
they might throw Him down over the cliff.
passing through the midst of them,
He went down to Capernaum, a city of Galilee,
was teaching them on the Sabbaths.
they were astonished at His teaching,
in the synagogue there was a man who had a spirit of an unclean demon.
he cried out with a loud voice,
What have we to do with You, Jesus of Nazareth?
Did You come to destroy us?
I know who You are -- the Holy One of God!"
the demon had thrown him in [their] midst,
with authority and power He commands the unclean spirits,
the report about Him went out into every place in the surrounding region.

they made request of Him concerning her.
all those who had any that were sick with various diseases brought them to Him;

for this purpose I have been sent."

the multitude pressed about Him to hear the word of God,

let down your nets for a catch."

drink with tax collectors and sinners?"

also the piece that was [taken] out of the new does not match the old.
no one puts new wine into old wineskins;
else the new wine will burst the wineskins
new wine must be put into new wineskins,
no one, having drunk old [wine], immediately desires new;

some of the Pharisees said to them,

what David did when he was hungry, he and those who were with him,

do good to those who hate you,

you want men to do to you,

you love those who love you,

you do good to those who do good to you,

you will be sons of the Most High.

it will be given to you,

with the same measure that you use, it will be measured back to you."

"A disciple is not above his teacher,
everyone who is perfectly trained will be like his teacher.
why do you look at the speck in your brother's eye,
do not perceive the plank in your own eye?
how can you say to your brother,

you yourself do not see the plank that [is] in your own eye?
First remove the plank from your own eye,
then you will see clearly to remove the speck that is in your brother's eye.
a good tree does not bear bad fruit,
does a bad tree bear good fruit.
every tree is known by its own fruit.
[men] do not gather figs from thorns,

"A good man out of the good treasure of his heart brings forth good;
an evil man out of the evil treasure of his heart brings forth evil.
out of the abundance of the heart his mouth speaks.
why do you call Me 'Lord, Lord,'

laid the foundation on the rock.
the stream beat vehemently against that house,
it was founded on the rock.
he who heard and did nothing is like a man
who built a house on the earth without a foundation,
against which the stream beat vehemently;
the ruin of that house was great."

said to the crowd that followed Him,

live in luxury are in kings' courts.
what did you go out to see?

wisdom is justified by all her children."
one of the Pharisees asked Him to eat with him.

behold, a woman in the city who was a sinner,
[Jesus] sat at the table in the Pharisee's house,
brought an alabaster flask of fragrant oil,
she began to wash His feet with her tears,
wiped [them] with the hair of her head;
the Pharisee who had invited Him saw [this],
would know who and what manner of woman [this] [is] who is touching Him,

"There was a certain creditor who had two debtors.
One owed five hundred denarii, and the other fifty.
they had nothing with which to repay,
which of them will love him more?"

you gave Me no water for My feet,
she has washed My feet with her tears
wiped [them] with the hair of her head.
this woman has not ceased to kiss My feet

this woman has anointed My feet with fragrant oil.
those who sat at the table with Him began to say to themselves,

bringing the glad tidings of the kingdom of God.
certain women who had been healed of evil spirits and infirmities -- Mary called Magdalene, out of whom had come seven demons,

they had come to Him from every city,
"A sower went out to sow his seed.
the birds of the air devoured it.
the thorns sprang up with it
"To you it has been given to know the mysteries of the kingdom of God,
The seed is the word of God.

takes away the word out of their hearts,
the ones on the rock [are] [those] who,
these have no root, who believe for a while
in time of temptation fall away.
